issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
I created a stack with a long description.  When I view it from the stacks landing page, I see that the description is not contained in the tile.  It runs off the edge.  I have attached a screenshot and the stack template I used for the issue.

Steps:
# Use the attached template to create a stack
# Once the stack completes, go to the stacks landing page
# Change the page to tile view

Expected results: The description of the stack should be contained in the tile
What actually happens: The description of the stack goes outside of the tile underneath it.
fields.summary: Stack description out of bounds in tile view on Stacks landing page

comments.body: one word... ellipsis.
Adam has ellipses filter that should take care of this.
Is this a simple fix?
Ought to be, assuming that it is ok that less information is displayed.  We can apply an ellipsis filter and truncate overflow info.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1956
When ellipses truncation has happened in the past, the entire content is available on mouseover. Something must have changed with this particular implementation because I am not seeing that anymore.
Like this?
We have classes and existing styling for tooltips (see the help icons for an example). Please use those.

[~jloza]: I'm not sure what changed to break the Foundation tooltips on the landing pages, but those no longer work for Angular-generated data sources.  I suggest we fall back to browser-based tooltips for now.  Adam suggested writing a custom tooltip directive to avoid breaking the Angular bindings, which sounds good to me.  Will defer to you if that's worth pursuing for 4.3.
Hm, so we can't style things on the landing pages to look the way they do on other pages?

If they can't be styled there (the styling is correct on the help icon tooltips like on the instance detail page for example) then please just write a bug against that so we can track things and we can move this one along.

For foundation tooltips to work w/ angular-updated content, it's necessary to watch that scope item and fire a foundation reflow for tooltips. I can look up an example. It is probably necessary to do that in a $timeout function so it completes after the current apply, but I'd try without first.

[~dkavanagh]An example would help.  In this case, Foundation is detaching the fragment from the DOM and displaying it elsewhere, thus breaking the binding.  What you see here is the contents of the binding, not the interpolated content {{item.description}} for example.

I admit that I had this problem w/ tips on the stack parameters form (in the stack wizard) and punted. But, here's where we do a tooltip reflow.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/static/js/pages/stack_wizard.js#L360
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/static/js/widgets/instance_selector.js#L256

I haven't had any luck with the foundation reflow.   So we're clear, it's not the styling that is the trouble, it's that when we use foundation tooltips with angular content, the binding is breaking when foundation moves fragments around in the DOM.

Falling back to browser tooltips for now.
IDK if this needs reviewing or what I am supposed to review, can you take a look and let me know, please?
UX review passed, ready for code review.
PR 1956 merged

Verified with AWS sample template obtained from https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/cloudformation-templates-us-west-2/EC2InstanceWithSecurityGroupSample.template
